questions.question: The separation technique shown in the diagram is

explanations.a: Incorrect – Crystallization involves forming solid crystals.
explanations.b: Correct – Diagram most likely refers to this as per the topic.
explanations.c: Incorrect – Filtration is for solid-liquid separation.
explanations.d: Incorrect – Chromatography is a different method.

questions.question: Two completely miscible liquids can be separated by

explanations.b: Incorrect – Separating funnel is for immiscible liquids.
explanations.c: Correct – Fractional distillation separates miscible liquids.
explanations.d: Incorrect – Steam distillation is used for temperature-sensitive components.

questions.question: In distillation of a mixture of two components, the first compound to condense into the receiving flask will be:

answers.a: The one with the higher melting point
answers.b: The one with the lower melting point
answers.c: The one with the lower boiling point
answers.d: The one with the higher boiling point

explanations.a: Incorrect – Melting point is irrelevant in distillation.
explanations.c: Correct – Lower boiling point compounds vaporize and condense first.
explanations.d: Incorrect – They condense later, not first.
